answers.author: Susan Robertson
answers.text:
We met with representatives of the City's bank to discuss how we might keep down bank fees.  It resulted in elimination of the service fees if we would keep a larger balance in the checking account.  Since the interest rate being paid by the State investment pool was so low, it was worth it to move more money into the checking account to get the service charges eliminated.  When interest rates start to rise enough, we will re-evaluate the situation.

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text:
In this low interest environment I was wondering what communities are doing to hold down or keep at zero fees and charges at local financial institutions?   Our previous banking agreements provided a host of services at no cost, now with dropping interest rates, local banks are proposing charges.
Thanks for your feedback.
